definition: Qin Shihuang (259-210 BC), the first emperor
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]
to begin/to start/then/only then
emperor/old variant of 惶[huang2]
surname Huang
the First Emperor 259-210 BC
the mausoleum of the First Emperor near Xi'an
the tomb of the first emperor at Mt Li 驪山|骊山[Li2 shan1] near Xi'an (awaits excavation)

sentences.english: Qin Shihuang, ancient China's unifier, burned books and buried scholars alive.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇，古代中国的统一者，焚书坑儒。

sentences.english: No excavation of Qin's tomb is planned.
sentences.chinese: 目前，中国没有继续挖掘秦始皇陵的计划。

sentences.english: There are indeed lots of mysteries about him.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵的神秘之处真是太多了。

sentences.english: Qin Shihuang had the Great Wall built to keep the enemy out of his empire.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇修长城是为了不让敌人进入他的帝国。

sentences.english: Well, is the Qin Shihuang Mausoleum very big?
Chin Shihhuang, also named Yingzheng , is the founder of the Qin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇，姓赢名政，是秦朝的开国皇帝。

sentences.english: Qinshihuang Mausoleum is the largest one of Emperor Mausoleums in our country.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵是我国最大的帝王陵园。

sentences.english: So we can say that the Qing emperor's character policy has a profound significance to the afterworld.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇的文字政策对后世有着深远意义。

sentences.english: Where is the Qin Shihuang Mausoleum you mentioned?
sentences.chinese: 你说的秦始皇陵到底在哪儿啊？

sentences.english: It is a nice site chosen for the mausoleum .
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵地方选得真好。

sentences.english: The guard of honor of Qin Shihuang.
These terracotta warriors have guarded the Qin Shinghuang Tomb for over 2,000 years.
sentences.chinese: 这些兵马俑已经守卫秦始皇陵两千多年了。

sentences.english: Lintong farmers found the Terracotta Warriors in Shanxi.
sentences.chinese: 陕西临潼农民发现秦始皇兵马俑。

sentences.english: The Qin Shihuang Mausoleum embodies the greatest cultural achievements of the Qin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵集中了秦代文明的最高成就。

sentences.english: And China's Qin Shihuang Mausoleum is the largest imperial tomb underground.
sentences.chinese: 而我们中国的秦始皇陵是世界上最大的地下皇陵。

sentences.english: Tomorrow, I look forward to seeing the Terra Cotta Warriors and the Old City walls.
sentences.chinese: 明天，我将回去参观秦始皇兵马俑和古长城。

definition: Qin Dynasty (221-207 BC)
Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
Qin Ershi (229-207 BC), second Qin emperor
the First Emperor 259-210 BC
posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
to burn the Confucian classics and bury alive the Confucian scholars (acts supposedly committed by the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2])
Han Dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Zhao Gao (?-207 BC), one of the most vile, corrupt and powerful eunuchs in Chinese history, responsible for the fall of Qin Dynasty
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
King Huiwen of Qin 秦國|秦国, ruled 338-211 BC during the Warring States Period
Li Si (c. 280-208 BC), Legalist philosopher, calligrapher and prime minister of Qin kingdom and Qin dynasty from 246 to 208 BC
Qin general Meng Tian (-210 BC), involved in 215 BC in fighting the Northern Xiongnu 匈奴 and building the great wall

Shang Yang (c. 390-338 BC), legalist philosopher and statesman of the state of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], whose reforms paved the way for the eventual unification of the Chinese empire by the Qin dynasty 秦朝|秦朝[Qin2 chao2]
Emperor Yang of Sui (569-618), said to have murdered his father and brother to seize the throne, reigned 604-618
Liu Bang (256 or 247-195 BC), bandit leader who became first Han emperor Han Gaozu 漢高祖|汉高祖 (reigned 202-195 BC)
